conclusion: To determine the work done by the frictional force as the object moves from point M to point N.
The frictional force is given by f_k = mu N where mu = 0.3 is the coefficient of kinetic friction, and N = mg is the normal force.
Calculate frictional force f_k = mu mg = 9 N.
Calculate acceleration a = f_k / m = 3 m/s^2.
The object accelerates until its speed equals the belt speed v = 6 m/s.
Determine time t = 2 s for the object to reach the belt speed using v = u + at.
Calculate distance s = 6 m traveled during acceleration using s = ut + 0.5at^2.
The total distance between the wheels M and N is L_1 = 10 m.
Analyze remaining distance: after accelerating for 6 m, the object travels 4 m at constant speed.
Calculate work done by friction W = f_k * s = 54 J.
The work done by the frictional force of the conveyor belt on the object as it is transported from point M to point N is 54 J.
